meanings.definition: To fill with sudden and overpowering surprise or wonder; amaze.
meanings.sent1: The magician's disappearing act never failed to astonish the audience.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected plot twist in the movie will astonish viewers.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog managed to astonish everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to speak multiple languages fluently would astonish even the most seasoned linguist.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the sunset never failed to astonish me.

meanings.definition: To strike with sudden and great wonder or surprise.
meanings.sent1: The news of his sudden resignation will astonish the entire company.
meanings.sent2: The grand fireworks display never fails to astonish the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a penguin wearing a top hat would astonish anyone.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the starry night sky never ceases to astonish me.
meanings.sent5: The speed of the cheetah as it chased its prey was truly astonishing.
